document_title: What is a pineal tumor? Symptoms, causes and diagnosis?
subsection_name: u-tuyen-tung.json_7_How to prevent pineal gland tumors
subsection_content:
This tumor is often formed as a result of trauma, inflammation, vascular disease, and hormonal imbalance. Therefore, when suffering from the above problems, patients need to see a doctor early for timely treatment, helping to prevent the development of pineal gland tumors.
Besides the effects related to the above diseases, pineal gland tumors can be congenital. To prevent this type of tumor, you need:
Have a proper pregnancy management process; Prevents hypoxia in the fetus.; Limit placental insufficiency; Maintain healthy living habits, especially for women with the intention of becoming mothers in the future.; Prevents uterine infections; Do not use medication during pregnancy without your doctor's permission; There is special control over the negative Rh factor in the mother's body.
If you need to schedule an examination for a pineal gland tumor or other brain tumor issues, you can contact the Department of Neurosurgery, Neurology Center at Tam Anh General Hospital System:
Above is the information you need to know about pineal gland tumors. Although the disease is on the list of relatively rare diseases, people should not be too subjective. Regularly check your general health, or pay attention to typical signs and symptoms of the disease to promptly go to the hospital for examination and treatment.
